title: False Amnesty Cycle
outcome: The Council, facing mounting unrest and the spread of independent support networks, decrees a citywide amnesty for all previous BCI offenses. For two weeks, thousands apply for record “clearing.” Initially, hope and gratitude rise, but it soon emerges that for each person cleared, someone else is quietly re-flagged to maintain system quotas. The old pattern of selective “amnesty” seen in earlier pilot programs reemerges. Disillusionment returns as activist groups expose this scheme and unrest simmers anew.

events.description: Council announces sweeping BCI amnesty for all previous offenses, triggering mass applications in person and online.
Initial celebrations as thousands see their records cleared. Social media fills with stories of new opportunities and restored access.
Data analysts inside the Council detect a one-for-one pattern: new clearances mirror new re-flaggings. Activists notice that net risk ratings remain unchanged.
Prominent residents publicly denounce 'fake amnesty' as evidence leaks online. Protests resume, angrier and more widespread than before.
